column2: in mediō autem deōs dījūdicat. ^ God hath stood in the congregation of gods
column3: and being in the midst of them he judgeth gods.

column2: et faciēs peccātōrum sūmitis? ^ How long will you judge unjustly
column3: and accept the persons of the wicked?

column1: 3 ^ Jūdicāte egēnō et pūpillō; humilem et pauperem jūstificāte. ^ Judge for the needy and fatherless; do justice to the humble and the poor.

column2: et egēnum dē manū peccātōris līberāte. ^ Rescue the poor
column3: and deliver the needy out of the hand of the sinner.

column2: neque intellēxērunt; in tenebrīs ambulant; movēbuntur omnia fundāmenta terrae. ^ They have not known nor understood; they walk on in darkness; all the foundations of the earth shall be moved.
et fīliī excelsī omnēs. ^ I have said: You are gods and all of you the sons of the most High.
et sīcut ūnus dē prīncipibus cadētis. ^ But you like men shall die
column3: and shall fall like one of the princes.

column4: quoniam tū hērēditābis in omnibus gentibus. ^ Arise
column7: for thou shalt inherit among all the nations.
